title: Attack on tourists in J&K: Over 20 feared dead in Pahalgam
content: At least 24 people, mostly tourists, were injured in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran Valley, Jammu and Kashmir. Authorities used helicopters and ponies for evacuation. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, currently in Saudi Arabia, condemned the attack, directed swift action, and asked home minister Amit Shah to visit the site.

title: People wail for help as loved ones lie in pools of blood: Pahalgan attack
content: Pahalgam in South Kashmir experienced a terror attack. Terrorists attacked a tourist spot in Baisaran Valley. The attack resulted in at least 20 injuries. Security forces and locals assisted in rescue operations. Authorities are investigating the incident. Top officials condemned the attack, and assured that the perpetrators will face consequences.

title: Meet Harshita Goyal: Second highest scorer of UPSC 2024
content: Harshita Goyal, securing All India Rank 2 in the UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024, exemplifies dedication and a desire to serve. A Chartered Accountant from MS University of Baroda, she aims to impact grassroots levels, drawing from her involvement with the Gujarat Youth Parliament and the Believe Foundation. Her focus includes women's empowerment, envisioning equal access to opportunities.

title: Trump Tariffs: Amazon CEO makes a 'promise', says that I understand why, I mean ...
content: Amidst escalating tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, Amazon is navigating challenges to shield consumers from rising costs. CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges the strain on businesses, anticipating price increases from third-party sellers. Amazon is strategically mitigating impact through bulk purchases and renegotiated contracts, while observing early signs of consumer stockpiling in response to expected price hikes.

title: Former cricketer questions BCCI's double standards in Kohli case
content: Aakash Chopra has questioned the BCCI's apparent double standard, pointing out that Virat Kohli escaped punishment for his aggressive celebration directed at Shreyas Iyer, while Digvesh Rathi was fined twice for his notebook celebration. Chopra also recalled MS Dhoni being fined for arguing with umpires, suggesting Kohli received preferential treatment.

title: 'Spreading misinformation ... ' EC slams Rahul's claims on Maha polls
content: The Election Commission refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of abnormal voter turnout in the final hours of the Maharashtra assembly elections, deeming his allegations against the electoral rolls an affront to the rule of law. EC sources emphasized that Congress representatives didn't raise concerns during scrutiny.

title: Microsoft’s chief HR to managers: This isn't just about Microsoft's success...
content: Microsoft is implementing stricter performance management policies, including a two-year rehire ban for underperformers and restrictions on internal transfers. These changes aim to accelerate high performance and swiftly address low performance, aligning with industry trends toward performance-based evaluations. The company is also introducing AI-supported tools to aid managers in performance conversations.

title: Trump impact: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast to 6.2%
content: The IMF's April 2025 World Economic Outlook revised India's 2025 GDP growth to 6.2%, down from the previously projected 6.5%, due to increased trade tensions and global uncertainty stemming from US tariff policies.

title: Watch: Saudi singer welcomes PM Modi to Jeddah with 'Ae Watan' song
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a grand welcome in Jeddah, marked by a soulful rendition of 'Ae Watan' by a Saudi singer and a Royal Saudi Air Force escort. A 21-gun salute further underscored the visit's importance.

title: Why Trump wants to fire Pete Hegseth
content: If the first leak was a lapse, the second looks like a pattern. And patterns — especially those that risk lives — are rarely tolerated long in Washington, even in a Trump-led administration where loyalty often trumps protocol.

title: Elon Musk DOGE declares victory on $382 million unemployment fraud
content: Elon Musk's DOGE flagged widespread unemployment benefit fraud, citing claims linked to impossible birth dates. However, these 'fake people' are likely pseudo records created by states to track and protect against fraudulent claims during the pandemic surge. While officials acknowledge past fraud, they clarify that DOGE's findings reflect previously identified issues, not current oversight failures.

title: Heart Wrenching Video Shows Woman's Plea For Help After J&K Terror Attack
content: "Please save my husband," a woman's bone-chilling wails echoed through the picturesque valleys of Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam after terrorists opened fire at tourists today.

title: Karnataka Businessman Killed In J&K Terror Attack, Siddaramaiah Holds Meeting
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah held an emergency meeting on Tuesday with senior officers in the wake of a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir in which one tourist from Karnataka was killed.

title: Amid 'Hindi Imposition' Row, Maharashtra Stays Order Making It Compulsory
content: The Devendra Fadnavis government of Maharashtra, days after making Hindi compulsory for primary classes, has backtracked amid strong objections from Opposition parties and Raj Thackeray's MNS (Maharashtra NAvnirman Sena).

title: "I Might Lose Job": Biker Who Fought With Air Force Officer Releases Video
content: The biker who got into a fight with an Indian Air Force officer on a Bengaluru road over rash driving has put out a video statement, accusing the officer of filing a false complaint against him and stressing that he "won't let this go".

title: Kashmir Terror Attack Updates: Several Feared Killed In J&K's Worst Terror Attack In Recent Times
content: Kashmir terror attack live updates: One tourist was killed and six people were injured in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam in Jammu & Kashmir's Anantnag district on Tuesday, sources said, adding that the number of deaths are likely to increase.

title: Multiple Casualties Reported In Terror Attack On Tourists In J&K: Sources
content: Several tourists were killed and many others were injured in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam in Jammu and Kashmir today.

title: Top Court's Bar Association Condemns Nishikant Dubey's Comments, Demands Action
content: The Supreme Court Bar Association has condemned BJP leader Nishikant Dubey over his comments against the Supreme Court, saying it was not just defamatory but "amounts to contempt of court".

title: Campbell Wilson To Step Down As Air India Express Chairman
content: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson will step down as the Chairman of Air India Express and Air India's Chief Commercial Officer Nipun Aggarwal will assume the chairmanship of the budget airline.

title: Thailand Convicts Ex-Prosecutors In Fugitive Red Bull Heir Hit-And-Run Case
content: A court in Thailand on Tuesday convicted two former prosecutors for misconduct in connection with a high-profile hit-and-run case involving the fugitive heir to the Red Bull energy drink empire.

title: "Topic Is So Complex": Kremlin Warns Against Rushing Ukraine Talks
content: The Kremlin on Tuesday warned against rushing Ukraine peace talks, pushing back on US President Donald Trump's hopes for a speedy deal the day before Ukraine's allies are set to meet in London.

title: Pope Francis' Death: What We Know So Far
content: Pope Francis died of a stroke on Monday at the Vatican aged 88.His funeral is to be held Saturday in the presence of worshippers and dignitaries before a conclave of cardinals is convened to elect a successor.

title: PM Dials Amit Shah After Terror Attack, Home Minister To Leave For Srinagar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is in Saudi Arabia, dialled Home Minister Amit Shahsoon after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalagam that claimed a tourist's life.

title: Puppet Shows, Elephants, Forts: How The Vance Kids Fell In Love With India
content: In a chat with NDTV, Usha Vance, the Indian-origin Second Lady of the US, who has roots in Andhra Pradesh, shared her excitement about seeing the iconic Mughal-era monument with her children.

title: NDTV Exclusive - "Took 1st Opportunity We Got To Come To India": Usha Vance
content: Usha Vance, the Second Lady of the United States, spoke to NDTV  about the 'family man' side of her husband and Vice President JD Vance, sharing heart-warming anecdotes about his fondness for Indian food and their three children's interest in India.

title: 'If a hot girl texts you ... ': Musk mocks crypto scams in viral X post
content: Elon Musk cautioned against cryptocurrency scams on X with a viral image, highlighting scammers' use of fake profiles, often posing as attractive women, to lure victims. The post underscores that these messages, despite appearances, are frequently sent by male scammers. Musk's warning addresses the serious issue of crypto-related fraud on social media, where scammers exploit users for financial gain.

title: Man who told Bengaluru driver to 'speak Hindi' apologises in Kannada
content: A video showing a man demanding an auto driver speak Hindi in Bengaluru sparked a language debate. The man, dubbed the 'Hindi warrior,' later apologized in Kannada, claiming he didn't intend to offend and regretted his outburst.

title: 'Our kids just like him, food was too good': Vance on visit to PM Modi's home
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited Prime Minister Narendra Modi's residence in New Delhi. Vance shared his positive experience, highlighting the Prime Minister's hospitality and its impact on his children, with his eldest son even expressing a desire to live in India.

title: Australia reacts to reports of banning visa of Indians from 'specific states'
content: Australia has refuted claims that it's restricting student visa applications from Indian states like Punjab and Gujarat. The Australian High Commission in New Delhi clarified that no such ban exists, emphasizing the strong educational ties between the two nations. Over 125,000 Indian students are currently studying in Australia, highlighting their significant contribution.

title: 'Shocked beyond belief': CM Omar Abdullah condemns Palgham terror attack
content: In a shocking incident, terrorists opened fire on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district, specifically in the Baisaran Valley area of Pahalgam, injuring several. Security forces swiftly responded to the attack in the remote area, often called 'mini-Switzerland'. Injured tourists were admitted to a local hospital, with some evacuated by helicopter.

title: Farewell to Pope Francis: List of world leaders attending Saturday's funeral
content: Pope Francis, the first Latin American pontiff, will be laid to rest on Saturday in St Peter’s Square, concluding his 12-year papacy. World leaders, including US President Trump and UK Prime Minister Starmer, will attend. He will lie in state for three days, and his wish was to be buried at the Basilica of St Mary Major.

title: PM Modi's approval rating makes me jealous: JD Vance - Top quotes
content: US Vice President JD Vance, during his visit to India, lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi's popularity, expressing envy over his approval ratings. He further emphasised that, "We're not here to preach that you do things any one particular way. Too often in the past, Washington approached Prime Minister Modi with an attitude of preaching."

title: Amid Waqf row, Owaisi's 'Ya-Habibi' jibe at PM Modi's Saudi visit
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has criticized the new Waqf law. He also commented on Narendra Modi's Saudi Arabia visit. Owaisi suggested Modi ask the Crown Prince about Medina's land status. He defended Waqf's presence in Muslim countries. Owaisi addressed the separation of powers. He said the judiciary will intervene if the government misuses power.

title: Beware! Delhi vehicles without fuel stickers to be fined: How to apply online
content: Delhi vehicle owners, take note! The Transport Department warns that lacking a fuel-based colour-coded sticker could result in a fine. This initiative, mandated by the Supreme Court and part of pollution control efforts, requires all vehicles in Delhi to display these chromium-based hologram stickers. These stickers help authorities quickly identify fuel types.

title: Trump admin bars pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil from attending son's birth
content: Dr Abdalla issued a statement on Monday, calling ICE’s refusal “a purposeful decision... to make me, Mahmoud, and our son suffer.”  “My son and I should not be navigating his first days on earth without Mahmoud. ICE and the Trump administration have stolen these precious moments from our family in an attempt to silence Mahmoud’s support for Palestinian freedom,” she said.

title: Marijuana, cannabis usage can cause dementia within just 5 years
content: Growing marijuana popularity, fueled by perceived medicinal benefits, faces scrutiny due to links with severe health risks. A recent study reveals a concerning association between cannabis-related medical emergencies and an increased risk of dementia within five years. While medical marijuana has potential benefits, its psychoactive effects and the risk of cannabis use disorder raise concerns about its overall safety.

title: 'I drink 5 litres of …': MS Dhoni finally breaks silence on viral rumour
content: MS Dhoni recently addressed a long-standing rumour about his diet, specifically the claim that he consumed five litres of milk daily. Dhoni humorously dismissed this, stating he might have had a litre throughout the day. He also laughed off another rumour about making lassi in a washing machine, clarifying he doesn't even drink lassi.

title: UPSC 2025 results declared: 1009 candidates recommended
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the final results of the Civil Services Examination, 2024. Shakti Dubey has topped the list of 1009 recommended candidates. The result includes appointments to the IAS, IFS, IPS, and Central Services (Group A and B). A reserve list of 230 candidates has also been maintained. The result, released in April 2025, includes category-wise and disability-wise details, with full marks expected to be available on the UPSC website soon.

title: 18 years, zero returns: China's stock market stuck in time even as Nifty surges 500%
content: Despite China's impressive economic growth over the past 18 years, its stock market performance, as reflected in the Shanghai Composite and Hang Seng indices, has been stagnant compared to the S&P 500 and Nifty 50.

title: Israeli strikes kill 14 in Gaza and destroy heavy equipment needed to clear rubble
content: Israeli strikes in Gaza resulted in the deaths of at least 14 Palestinians, predominantly women and children, and destroyed vital equipment for rubble clearance. Separate strikes in Lebanon led to two fatalities. The ongoing Israeli offensive has devastated Gaza, raising concerns about reconstruction, amidst shortages of essential equipment and restricted imports.

title: Man stabbed to death after dispute over bidi in Delhi's Pul Prahladpur
content: In a tragic incident in South East Delhi's Pul Prahladpur, a 21-year-old man named Sohaib was fatally stabbed following a dispute over a bidi. The altercation escalated when Sohaib, his brother Mohsin, and their mother confronted the attackers, resulting in serious injuries to Mohsin and a friend. Police have arrested three individuals and recovered blood-stained knives from the crime scene.

title: Advantage India in US-China war: Air India eyes Boeing jets refused by Chinese
content: Air India is considering acquiring Boeing aircraft initially meant for Chinese airlines, capitalizing on trade tensions between the US and China. Air India aims to bolster its transformation efforts with these additional aircraft.

title: "Political Interference Endangering Higher Education": US Universities
content: More than 100 US universities and colleges, including Ivy League institutions Princeton and Brown, issued a joint letter on Tuesday condemning President Donald Trump's "political interference" in the education system.

title: "Discreet Death, Did Not Suffer": Vatican Recounts Pope Francis' Last Hours
content: Pope Francis thanked his personal nurse for encouraging him to greet the crowds in St Peter's Square on Easter Sunday, according to the Vatican, which said that these were amongst his last words.

title: "Larger Than Anything...": Omar Abdullah On Terror Attack On Tourists In J&K
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah condemned the terror attack on tourists in Pahalgam, saying it was an "abomination". The perpetrators were "animals, inhuman and worthy of contempt"

title: PM Modi To Meet "Brother" MBS Soon, Talks Of "Limitless" India-Saudi Ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a strategically significant visit to Saudi Arabia as the two nations aim to elevate their ties to an all new level.

title: "Maybe I Can Live In India": What JD Vance's Son Said After PM's Dinner
content: US Vice-President J D Vance on Tuesday called Prime Minister Narendra Modi a "special person", and revealed he was only the second world leader apart from President Donald Trump his children are fond of.

title: Aurangabad Bench Of Bombay High Court Receives Bomb Threat On Email
content: A bomb threat was made to the Aurangabad bench of the Bombay High Court on Tuesday, leading to a search of its building by police in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar city in Maharashtra, said an official.

title: Indian cricketer breaks silence on domestic violence and dowry charges
content: Amit Mishra, the former Indian spinner, has refuted media reports alleging his involvement in a domestic violence and dowry harassment case filed by his wife. He dismissed the accusations, including demands for compensation and dowry, as incorrect and warned of legal action against using his image in unrelated stories.

title: Who is Shakti Dubey, the IAS topper of UPSC CSE 2024?
content: Shakti Dubey from Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, topped the UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) 2024, securing All India Rank 1. With a background in Biochemistry from Allahabad University and Banaras Hindu University, she transitioned from teaching to civil services after seven years of dedicated preparation. Opting for Political Science and International Relations as her optional subject, Dubey's success highlights her academic versatility and perseverance. Her achievement inspires aspirants from small towns aiming for administrative excellence.

title: Something massive happening beneath Himalayas that could break Indian plate into two: Study
content: A recent study challenges the long-held belief of the Indian plate smoothly sliding under the Eurasian plate. Seismic data reveals the Indian plate is splitting in two beneath Tibet, with the lower portion peeling away into the Earth's mantle.

title: Andre Russell's shocking struggle against leg-spinners exposed
content: Andre Russell's below-par IPL 2025 season has sparked concerns, with the KKR all-rounder struggling against leg-spin. Dismissed by spinners 21 times, 14 against leg-spin, his vulnerability was exposed in a recent match against GT. Despite Dwayne Bravo's support, Russell's form is impacting KKR, who are currently seventh in the points table.

title: 'Parliament is supreme': VP Dhankhar renews attack on judiciary over powers
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar emphasized the supremacy of Parliament and the ultimate authority of elected legislators at a Constitutional lecture series at Delhi University. He highlighted that public representatives are accountable to the people, who hold the supreme power.

title: Royal escort: Saudi fighter jets escort PM Modi’s plane - Watch
content: In a rare display of camaraderie, Saudi fighter jets escorted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's aircraft as it entered Saudi airspace en route to Jeddah, underscoring the robust ties between India and Saudi Arabia.

title: IIT-Kharagpur student found hanging in hostel room
content: Aniket Walkar, a 22-year-old IIT-Kharagpur student, was tragically found dead in his hostel room on Sunday evening, prompting a police investigation. This marks the third student death at the institute in less than a year. Despite being a high-achieving student with a job offer, Aniket's death has left friends and faculty shocked.

title: Air tag, passport copy expose wife's affair, crack Dubai-returnee's murder
content: A suitcase found in a UP field led to the shocking murder of Naushad Ahmad, who had returned from Dubai days earlier. Police traced clues like a passport copy and airport tag to uncover that his wife and nephew—also her lover—allegedly killed and dismembered him. The duo feared exposure of their affair. Both accused have been arrested.

title: Goodbye China, Namaste India! Laptop brands shift production
content: India's IT hardware PLI scheme is boosting domestic laptop production as global brands partner with Indian manufacturers amid China-US trade tensions. Companies like Asus, MSI and HP are establishing or expanding local manufacturing, attracted by incentives.

title: Trainer aircraft crashes in Gujarat's Amreli, pilot killed
content: A trainer aircraft belonging to a private aviation academy crashed in Gujarat's Amreli on Tuesday, resulting in the death of the pilot. The accident occurred around 12:30 pm near Giriya Road, shortly after the pilot took off from Amreli airport. The aircraft struck a tree before crash-landing in an open plot near Shastri Nagar, preventing further casualties.

title: Sources: Browns, Giants field trade calls for picks
content: The Browns and Giants are fielding trade inquiries for their early picks in the NFL draft, sources told ESPN.

title: Finally healthy, Kawhi's throwback effort ties series
content: Kawhi Leonard, who scored 39 points Monday night to help the Clippers even their series with the Nuggets, said afterward, "I'm just happy that I'm able to move" after watching the past two playoffs from the sidelines.

title: Sources: UCLA's Aguilar to transfer to Tennessee
content: Quarterback Joey Aguilar, who threw for 6,760 yards and 56 touchdowns the past two years with Appalachian State, plans to transfer to Tennessee after transferring to UCLA in the winter portion of the transfer portal, sources told ESPN's Chris Low Monday.

title: R&A weighs return to Trump's Turnberry for Open
content: The R&A would like to see Turnberry return as host of The Open, but it will first need to assess the feasibility of the venue, which is owned by President Trump.

title: Thibs: Brunson not getting calls like Cunningham
content: The Knicks-Pistons first-round playoff series is even -- and Knicks coach Tom Thibodeau said afterward the free throws need to be as well.

title: Harrison: Didn't know fans' level of love for Luka
content: Nico Harrison said he underestimated the level to which Mavericks fans cared for Luka Doncic and reiterated the blowback to the trade would've eased if the team had been healthy.

title: Source: Younger Iamaleava to join Nico at UCLA
content: Madden Iamaleava, the younger brother of Nico Iamaleava, is expected to join the former Tennessee quarterback at UCLA, a source said Monday.

title: WrestleMania 41 top-grossing WWE event ever
content: WWE's annual event, WrestleMania 41, saw a viewership increase of 114% over the record set last year, the promotion said in a statement Tuesday, as well as 45% increase in merchandise sales onsite.

title: 'Completely separate and at odds': The divisions and chaos that led to the end of the Luka Doncic era in Dallas
content: Doncic's time in Dallas ended with a shocking trade on Feb. 2, but the beginning of the end dates to the summer of 2023.

title: SGA or Jokic? Castle or Risacher? Our experts pick every NBA award
content: Finalists have been unveiled for seven major individual awards, including MVP. Which superstars did our experts' pick?

title: 'Once-in-a-lifetime experience:' How the NFL's smallest market is coming up big to host the draft
content: The Lambeau countdown clock to the draft is running out of days, and the NFL's smallest town is ready.

title: Thanks to Flick and young stars, treble-chasing Barcelona are fun again
content: The financial issues still remain for Barcelona, but they're back to their brilliant best on the pitch as LaLiga, Copa del Rey and Champions League are all still within reach.

title: Source: Man Utd eye Wolves, Brazil star Cunha
content: Manchester United are exploring the possibility of triggering the release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract at Wolves, a source has told ESPN.

title: Leeds, Burnley win, clinch Premier League return
content: Leeds United and Burnley have been promoted to the Premier League after Scott Parker's side beat third-placed Sheffield United on Monday.

title: Alonso has 'gentleman's agreement' to exit Bayer
content: Bayer Leverkusen's CEO has said the club has a "gentleman's agreement" with Xabi Alonso that means he could take over at Real Madrid or Liverpool.

title: UEFA give Man City $6m for most int'l call-ups
content: Manchester City were allocated around €5.17 million ($5.94m), the most of any UEFA club, as part of the European football governing body's Club Benefits Programme to encourage national team participation by players.

title: Wrexham edge closer to promotion with key win
content: Wrexham climbed back into the automatic promotion spots in League 1 with a crucial 2-1 win over Blackpool on Monday.

title: Leeds boss to celebrate promotion like 'fire beast'
content: Leeds United head coach Daniel Farke said he plans to revel in Leeds United's return to the Premier League like a "fire beast."

title: Postecoglou rues 'unacceptable' loss to Forest
content: The rare smile Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou wore four days ago in Frankfurt was replaced by the more familiar frown as a 2-1 home defeat to Nottingham Forest made it 18 Premier League losses for the London club this season.

title: Chivas fires Espinoza after missing postseason
content: Chivas has sacked head coach Gerardo Espinoza after the Liga MX giants recently closed out the 2025 Clausura regular season without making the playoffs.

title: South Carolina up, UCLA down: How the transfer portal impacts the women's Way-Too-Early Top 25﻿
content: Big transfers have put South Carolina at No. 1 and propelled the likes of LSU, Oklahoma and Tennessee higher.

title: 'I found your dad': The mystery of a missing climber
content: Bill Stampfl vanished climbing Peru's highest mountain 22 years ago. This is the story of the hiker who found him and brought closure to Stampfl's family.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025 WNBA season
content: Which WNBA players will exceed fantasy expectations in 2025? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to reach an elite level? Eric Moody and Andre Snellings list their picks.

title: 'Hello, old friend': Randy Orton delivers surprise RKO on John Cena at Raw
content: A day after winning his record 17th WWE title, John Cena ran into a familiar foe on Monday Night Raw.

title: WrestleMania 41 results: Cena makes history, beats Rhodes for WWE Undisputed title
content: The next chapter of John Cena's farewell tour kicks off with the WWE Universal championship around his waist.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye River Plate star Mastantuono
content: Manchester United are considering a move for emerging River Plate star Franco Mastantuono. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Special team to complete initial probe into Parunthumpara land grab before May 5
content: People holding plots in contentious survey numbers asked to submit land-related documents. Those with valid papers can hold possession of land. Action will be taken against those who don’t have valid documents

title: BJP’s bid to make political gains by creating smokescreen over Munambam failed, says Sathish
content: Misleading the people and creating a smokescreen will be short-lived, as facts will emerge sooner rather than later, especially in a democratic society like Kerala with an independent media, says the newly elected CPI(M) Ernakulam district secretary

title: Hyderabad a talent hotspot for mid-market GCCs
content: As high-impact innovation hubs, such facilities of enterprises with global revenues from $100 million to $1 billion annually are set to drive next phase of growth of GCC ecosystem in India: Nasscom-Zinnov report

title: Karnataka High Court rejects plea challenging Siddaramaiah’s election from Varuna constituency
content: ‘Petition was drafted with vague pleadings and factual errors, and in a very casual manner,’ says the court

title: MLA aims to achieve full literacy in Kovur constituency
content: Development of 82 panchayats in the constituency is in the hands of local leaders and the people, says Vemireddy Prashanthi Reddy

title: Hubballi-Dharwad Municipal Corporation temporarily drops waste cess, drainage user charge
content: Decision comes following public outrage over indiscriminate tax hike and strong opposition from Karnatak Chamber of Commerce and Industry

title: PDO suspended for harassing GP staff leading to his death in Bidar district
content: The deceased staff is said to have been frustrated over being denied his salary for the last two years

title: Manipur police warns personnel against attending Kuki group’s meeting
content: Authorities said any uniformed personnel found attending the meeting of these “fictitious” organisations would be considered to have “committed gross service misconduct”, entailing strict disciplinary action

title: Officials urged to raise awareness on schemes available for nomadic communities
content: Poor implementation of programmes draws flak at meeting chaired by Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Nomadic Development Corporation chairperson

title: T.N. government plans to commission defence and aerospace park in Coimbatore by the end of 2025
content: The 350-acre park coming up at Varapatti will have industries in the semiconductor, defence, and aerospace sectors

title: Kurnool SP tells villagers to prioritise education of children
content: Vikrant Patil visits Bommireddipalle and interacts with the residents as part of an outreach session following the recent disturbances reported in the village

title: With growing tiger population, Madhya Pradesh to develop buffer zones around tiger reserves
content: The tiger population in the buffer zones of the State’s nine tiger reserves has increased from 526 to 785 over the past four years, underlining the importance of continued conservation efforts, the State govt. said

title: Five women, three minor victims killed as vehicle falls off bridge in Madhya Pradesh’s Damoh
content: The SUV appears to have been travelling at speed, the police said; all the victims belonged to one family

title: Gandhi Bhavan inaugurated in Dharwad
content: Gandhi’s life and fight and the ideals advocated by him continue to be the guiding principles of various governments, claims Minister

title: Ganja should not enter Anantapur district, warns SP
content: P. Jagadeesh conducts raids at the Anantapur railway station focussing on trains passing through Anantapur, Gooty and Guntakal

title: FEFKA issues final warning to actor Shine Tom Chacko
content: FEFKA general secretary B. Unnikrishnan says they have informed the actors family that he requires professional assistance to overcome the problem of drug use. It decides not cooperate with him if he violates the assurance not to create any more problems

title: A.P. witnessing ‘atrocious developments’ during NDA rule, alleges Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: YSRCP president asks the party cadre to help people understand the ‘malicious intentions’ of the government

title: Investors invited to boost tourism sector in Kurnool
content: We have grand tourist destinations in Kurnool, including the Ramajal Reservoir, Gajuladinne Damodaram Sanjeevayya Sagar Project, Erugudi village, Banavasi village, Jain temple, Sri Lakshmi Jagannathagattu, Orvakallu Rock Garden, and Gargayapuram Reservoir, says Collector

title: Naidu using arrests to divert attention from govt. failures: Ambati Rambabu
content: The YSRCP leader accuses CM of targeting former Intelligence chief for his role in the arrest of Mr. Naidu earlier in connection with a skill development scam case

title: Minister tells officials to address drinking water crisis in villages in Nandyal district
content: Responding to an appeal from the minority community of Kapulapalle village, the Minister approves the construction of a compound wall around the local mosque

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: 46 exam centres for APEAPCET 2025 in A.P. and two in Hyderabad, says JNTU-K V-C
content: The last date for submitting applications without a fine is April 24; candidates can make changes in applications between May 6 and 8

title: 181: a helpline to ensure women safety
content: Number of calls received by 181 Women Helpline has been climbing every year — from 11,699 service calls in 2017 to 1,44,389 in 2024

title: Welfare assistant suspended for withholding NTR Bharosa pensions for eight months
content: The welfare assistant misled several beneficiaries, saying that their pension amounts were not credited due to shortage of funds and it would be distributed shortly

title: Telangana’s heat divide: Why some districts are facing extreme temperatures than others?
content: As per the HAP report, heatwave conditions in India are considered if the maximum temperature of a station reaches at least 40°C or more for plains, 37°C or more for coastal areas and at least 30°C or more for hilly regions

title: Hebbal flyover’s new ramp to open only by May, but might not provide expected relief
content: The work has led to commuters getting stuck for long periods of time even during non-peak hours on the flyover that is notorious for its traffic snarls.

title: Shivamogga man killed in J&K terror attack
content: The body of 47-year-old Manjunath is expected to be taken to Srinagar and airlifted to Karnataka later.

title: CM moots Hiroshima-Telangana Automotive & Mobility Corridor
content: TelanganaRising delegation holds discussions with Hiroshima Prefecture Govt on underground metro, renewable energy, academic programmes and more

title: America wants access to Indian markets, says U.S. VP J.D. Vance in Jaipur
content: ‘Trade relations must be based on fairness,’ Mr. Vance said referring to President Donald Trump’s policy on trade and tariff

title: Supreme Court schedules Pegasus hearing for next week

title: Unauthorised subletting of properties in T.N. will be registered as criminal cases: DGP at Madras High Court
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira appreciates the State Public Prosecutor and DGP for the initiative and insists on wide circulation of an awareness video prepared by the police department

title: Neither Parliament nor Executive, Constitution is supreme: Kapil Sibal hits back at Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: Kapil Sibal points at Indian Constitution’s supremacy over Parliament and Executive, criticizes Vice-President’s remarks on Supreme Court order

title: 94.3 % government polytechnic students in Andhra Pradesh secure campus placements in academic year 2024-25
content: The highest package offered so far was ₹9.2 LPA and the lowest ₹1.8 LPA, while the average package is ₹2.2 LPA, Director of the Department of Technical Education G. Ganesh Kumar said

title: DC orders probe into axing of 40 trees in Mysuru, constitutes three-member committee
content: The committee, to be headed by the MUDA Commissioner, to conduct a thorough investigation and submit report in seven days

title: Watch: Kancha Ilaiah Shepherd interview | Why the legacy of the Phules still scares the powerful
content: Why does the story of Mahatma Jyotiba Phule and Savitribai Phule still make the powerful uncomfortable? Why are their lives — which sparked one of India’s earliest social revolutions — still being silenced or softened?

title: Government placing special focus on North Andhra irrigation projects: Minister Nimmala Ramanaidu
content: The Minister accompanied by MLAs inspected the Tarkarama Teertha Sagar project, which is expected to cater to irrigation of 20,000 acres of land and provide drinking water facility for Vizianagaram City and Bhogapuram international airport

title: Hybrid ganja case in Kerala: Couple’s arrest opens a pandora’s box
content: Excise department sleuths uncover large haul of hybrid ganja, leading to arrests and links to the film industry

title: Errors, if any, in caste census report will be corrected, says Karnataka CM

title: Sharad Pawar downplays meetings with nephew Ajit, says nothing wrong in discussing people's issues

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Several tourists feared dead, at least 20 injured in Jammu and Kashmir’s Anantnag district
content: Tourists injured in Pahalgam terrorist attack, woman survivor pleads for help evacuating injured to hospital

title: New water troughs bring relief to livestock in Andhra Pradesh’s scorching summer
content: These troughs are being set up in villages identified by the Animal Husbandry department to quench the thirst of cattle, goats, and sheep

title: ‘Bihar needs energetic leader with vision’: LJP pitches bigger role for Chirag Paswan

title: Waqf tribunal being established in Madurai: T.N. Minister
